mdRecord.dcterms:title: Amérique Septentrionale / publiée sous les auspices de Monseigneur le Duc d'Orleans prémier prince du sang, par le Sr. D'Anville, MDCCXLVI
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Anville, Jean Baptiste Bourguignon d', 1697-1782 [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 1 map on 4 sheets : hand col. ; 46 x 86 cm.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Lower right: Gravé par Guill'. Delahaye. [original]
Inset: untitled, showing Hudson's Bay and Greenland. [original]
Cartouche designed by Sr. Gravelot, engraved by Sr. Major. [original]

Described by bookseller as the original issue of Anvill'es map, with a definite dotted boundary line from the "Montagnes d'Apalache" crossing the Cherokee River to the west border of South Carolina, and with very few branches of the Ohio River shown. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS. Copy 1-2: In both copies, some sheets have been pasted together to form 2 pieces. Tracy W. McGregor Library, American History Collection. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: North America--Maps--Early works to 1800
